<p>5 rows × 3120 columns</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We should clean the data for a better usability and to increase the speed of analysis (I added some unfamiliar variables for future):</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">needed_fields</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"QUESTID2"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"LSD"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"LSDAGE"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"LSDAGLST"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                 <span class="s2">"CIGTRY"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"CIG30AV"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"CIGAGE"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"ALCYRTOT"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                 <span class="s2">"COCEVER"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"HEREVER"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"CRKEVER"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"METHDES"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                 <span class="s2">"DIETPILS"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"MJEVER"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="n">needed_fields</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I decided to start with LSD interview item. I found these variables in the codebook: LSD (ever used LSD ("acid")), LSDAGE (age when first used LSD), LSDAGLST (how old were you the last time used LSD).</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now I want to know how many people ever tried LSD:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">lsd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'LSD'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">agg</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s2">"QUESTID2"</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'count'</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">lsd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'COUNT'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">lsd_prc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">lsd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">100</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()))</span>
<span class="n">lsd_prc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'PERCENT'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">lsd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">lsd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lsd_prc</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">lsd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div style="max-width:1500px;overflow:auto;">
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>COUNT</th>
<th>PERCENT</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>LSD</th>
<th></th>
<th></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>3647</td>
<td>6.598755</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>3759</td>
<td>6.801404</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>2</td>
<td>0.003619</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>91</th>
<td>47816</td>
<td>86.516610</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>94</th>
<td>39</td>
<td>0.070565</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>97</th>
<td>5</td>
<td>0.009047</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We need to transcript this and analyse what we get. 1 means "yes", 2 - "no", 3 means "yes", but logicaly assigned, 91 means "never used hallucinogens", 94 - "don't know" and 97 - "refused".</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">lsd</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"ANSWER"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Yes"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"No"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Yes (logicaly assigned)"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                 <span class="s2">"Never"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Don't know"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"Refused"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">lsd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[10]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div style="max-width:1500px;overflow:auto;">
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>COUNT</th>
<th>PERCENT</th>
<th>ANSWER</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>LSD</th>
<th></th>
<th></th>
<th></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>3647</td>
<td>6.598755</td>
<td>Yes</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>3759</td>
<td>6.801404</td>
<td>No</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>2</td>
<td>0.003619</td>
<td>Yes (logicaly assigned)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>91</th>
<td>47816</td>
<td>86.516610</td>
<td>Never</td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td>0.070565</td>
<td>Don't know</td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td>0.009047</td>
<td>Refused</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>With these data we constructed a pie chart. For well-looking it would be better to put down items with percentage lower than 1.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline
<span class="n">lsd</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">lsd</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'PERCENT'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="s1">'PERCENT'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pie</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">labels</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Yes'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'No'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Never'</span><span class="p">],</span>
                             <span class="n">colors</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'yellowgreen'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'gold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'lightskyblue'</span><span class="p">],</span>
                            <span class="n">explode</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">0.1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">autopct</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">%1.1f%%</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">shadow</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">suptitle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Have you ever, even once, used LSD, also called "acid"?'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">16</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'equal'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">

<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>So, it's only 6.6% ever tried LSD. Does it means hippies are still alive? Still, we have another interesting variable: age when first used lsd. For this data type it is nice to construct histogram for better visualiztion. This time I defined a function for histogram, because we will need it in future.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">hist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">field</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">max</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xsteps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'green'</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">lsd_age</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">field</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="nb">max</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="n">field</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">lsd_age</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">hist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">bins</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">max</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">b</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">suptitle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">16</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">max</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xsteps</span><span class="p">))</span>
    
<span class="n">hist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'LSDAGE'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">68</span><span class="p">,</span> 
     <span class="s1">'How old were you the first time you used LSD?'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
     <span class="s1">'Ages of first use LSD'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'pink'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>

<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>What a beatiful colorful childhood it was! I guess, we shouldn't care about some obviously false answers like "I was 1 (2/3/..) when i first time used LSD". For now, let's take a look at histogram with LAST time used LSD.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">hist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'LSDAGLST'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">69</span><span class="p">,</span> 
     <span class="s1">'How old were you the last time you used LSD?'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
     <span class="s1">'Ages of last use LSD'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'red'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Interesting, some (and many) people said they used LSD last time at the age of 18. Should we trust them? I don't think so. I think it's time to take a rest from hallucinogens and construct same histograms for smoking people.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">hist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'CIGTRY'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">69</span><span class="p">,</span> 
     <span class="s1">'How old were you the first time you smoked part or all of a cigarette?'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
     <span class="s1">'Ages of first smoked a cigarette'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'burlywood'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>So many teenagers tried smoking so early, but only 18 is the "best" age to start smoking everyday. Dear parents, I think you should take it into consideration.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now, let's take a look how LSD usage (ever once) correlate with the usage of other drugs. I constructed bar chart with yes-no answers to illustrate this correlation.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">lsd_something_prc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">field</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">title</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">lsd_try</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"LSD"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">no_lsd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"LSD"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">lsd_try</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">lsd_try</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">lsd_try</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">field</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">field</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">agg</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s2">"QUESTID2"</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'count'</span><span class="p">})</span>
    <span class="n">no_lsd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">no_lsd</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">no_lsd</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">field</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">field</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">agg</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s2">"QUESTID2"</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'count'</span><span class="p">})</span>
    <span class="n">lsd_try</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'COUNT'</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">lsd_try</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">lsd_try</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()))</span>
    <span class="n">lsd_try</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Ever used lsd'</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">no_lsd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'COUNT'</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">no_lsd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">no_lsd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()))</span>
    <span class="n">no_lsd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Never used lsd'</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">lsd_coc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">lsd_try</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">no_lsd</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">lsd_coc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'pink'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'blue'</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">b</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">suptitle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">16</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"Yes"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"No"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">rotation</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'horizontal'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Percent'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylim</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ymax</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">lsd_something_prc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"MJEVER"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                  <span class="s2">"Have you ever, even once, used marijuana or hashish?"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">lsd_something_prc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"COCEVER"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                  <span class="s2">"Have you ever, even once, used any form of cocaine?"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">lsd_something_prc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"HEREVER"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                  <span class="s2">"Have you ever, even once, used heroin?"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">lsd_something_prc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"CRKEVER"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                  <span class="s2">"Have you ever, even once, used crack?"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">lsd_something_prc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"DIETPILS"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                  <span class="s2">"Have you ever, even once, used prescription diet pills, such as Amphetamines (etc)?"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">lsd_something_prc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"METHDES"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                  <span class="s2">"Have you ever, even once, used Methamphetamine, Desoxyn, or Methedrine?"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>What does it mean? Maybe people who ever once tried any drugs are more open for experiments. But it's obvious that marijuana is the most popular drug and heroin is the most unpopular (thank God).</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>At this interesting point, I want to finish my first data analysis. There are a lot of data in this database, so analysis might become endless. But for now I want to say goodbye and wish you a good health.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
